I use it for boilerplate. It's faster than searching StackOverflow. A real time-saver.
I use it for boilerplate. It's faster than searching StackOverflow. A real time-saver.
Great for refactoring code and writing documentation. It saves me so much time on boring meetings and docs.
I was skeptical, but it's great for brainstorming and getting first drafts done. I feel much more productive.
Great for refactoring code and writing documentation. It saves me so much time on boring meetings and docs.
I love it. Helps me learn new concepts faster and debug tricky problems. My productivity is through the roof.

Honestly, it's just a tool, but a very good one. Speeds up my workflow and helps me focus on the harder problems.

I'm worried. The boilerplate stuff was the easy part of my job. I have some anxiety about job security.
I hate that my boss expects us to use it. It feels like a threat to our jobs, and management is all for it.

It's so stupid sometimes. It gives me code that looks right but is completely wrong. Wastes my time debugging.
It's a threat, plain and simple. It's already good at junior-level tasks. What about in two years? My anxiety is high.
